title: N03-1033

sentences.text: We present a new part-of-speech tagger that demonstrates the following ideas : -LRB- i -RRB- explicit use of both preceding and following tag contexts via a dependency network representation , -LRB- ii -RRB- broad use of lexical features , including jointly conditioning on multiple consecutive words , -LRB- iii -RRB- effective use of priors in conditional loglinear models , and -LRB- iv -RRB- fine-grained modeling of unknown word features .
Using these ideas together , the resulting tagger gives a 97.24 % accuracy on the Penn Treebank WSJ , an error reduction of 4.4 % on the best previous single automatically learned tagging result .

Entity-the_resulting_tagger.label: the resulting tagger
Entity-the_resulting_tagger.description: A part-of-speech tagger that achieves a 97.24% accuracy and an error reduction of 4.4% on the Penn Treebank WSJ, resulting from the combination of explicit use of preceding and following tag contexts via dependency network representation, broad lexical features, effective priors in conditional loglinear models, and fine-grained modeling of unknown word features.

Entity-the_resulting_tagger_give_a_97.24.description: An evaluation metric that measures the accuracy and improvement in part-of-speech tagging

summary: We present a new part-of-speech tagger that demonstrates the following ideas : -LRB- i -RRB- explicit use of both preceding and following tag contexts via a dependency network representation , -LRB- ii -RRB- broad use of lexical features , including jointly conditioning on multiple consecutive words , -LRB- iii -RRB- effective use of priors in conditional loglinear models , and -LRB- iv -RRB- fine-grained modeling of unknown word features . Using these ideas together , the resulting tagger gives a 97.24 % accuracy on the Penn Treebank WSJ , an error reduction of 4.4 % on the best previous single automatically learned tagging result .

Predicate-demonstrates.label: demonstrates
Predicate-demonstrates.description: To demonstrate means to show or illustrate something, typically by providing evidence or examples that support an idea or concept. In this sense, the predicate 'demonstrates' connects the subject (the entity presenting or showing) with the object (what is being presented or shown), highlighting a relationship of explanation, illustration, or proof.

Predicate-gives_a_97.24__accuracy_on.label: gives a 97.24 % accuracy on
Predicate-gives_a_97.24__accuracy_on.description: Indicates that the subject has achieved or demonstrated a specific level of accuracy when applied to or evaluated against the object. The predicate highlights the performance metric and its corresponding value, providing insight into the effectiveness or quality of the subject's actions.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses another concept (the object), which serves as its more general category, superclass, or parent. This relationship suggests an hierarchical connection between the two concepts.
